intro: Ilex montebellensis, commonly known as the Montebello holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region, specifically found in parts of southern Europe and North Africa. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with glossy, dark green leaves that are typically oval in shape. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the autumn. Ilex montebellensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
